abstract: Paula Span The New Old Age column discusses significant percentage of elderly patients who are seriously ill, unable to make medical decisions for themselves, and have no close friends or family members to make decisions for them; hospitals, public agencies and legislators are trying to come up with new guidelines to help medical staff dilemma presented by 'unbefriended' patients.
lead_paragraph: Older patients without anyone to make medical decisions on their behalf are described as unbefriended. In a crisis, there is no one to speak for them.

headline.main: Near the End, It’s Best to Be ‘Friended’
headline.print_headline: The Last ‘Friend’ You May Ever Need
